project3.three
Class Query

java.lang.Object
  project3.three.Node
      project3.three.List
          project3.PredicateList
              project3.three.Query

public class Query
extends PredicateList

A Query in the datalog program. 

 Syntax: Query → Predicate "?"

 Domain Definition:
    predicates : Predicate; 

    setOfSolutions : SetOfSolutions
    -- A list of arrays of constants that represent the valid substitutions
    -- for the variables in the variable list. There is a one-to-one
    -- correspondence between the constants in an array and the variables in
    -- the query.

    variableInformation: QueryVariableInformation
    -- The set of variables in the Query, and, for each variable the 
    -- corresponding locations in the Query and current value of that
    -- variable.  

    variableIterator : Iterator
    -- An iterator over the variableInformation.  Inherited from 
    -- PredicateList

    Instance Invariant:
        |predicates| = 1
Last Modified: 21 Feb 2006

Version:
1.0
Author:
Scott N. Woodfield
See Also:

Field Detail

setOfSolutions

protected SetOfSolutions setOfSolutions
A list of Solutions where a Solution is an array of Constants such that the constants in the Solution have a one-to-one correspondence with the variables in the query.

See Also:
Source Code

copy

protected PredicateList copy
A copy of the orginal query. As we evaluate a query, we modify it. This copy is used to print the original query. We store the copy of a Query as a PredicateList so that when we apply the "toString()" method we use the "toString()" method of PredicateList rather than that of Query. We make this protected so we can access it during testing.

See Also:
Source Code

Query

public Query(Lex lex)
      throws ParserException
The lex-based constructor used to create a Query from the lexical analyzer.

Precondition: lex ≠ null AND
  PredicateList.Precondition
  |nodes| = 1
Postcondition: PredicateList.Postcondition AND
  setOfSolutions = new SetOfSolutions(variableInformation.getVariables())

Parameters:
lex - the lexical analyzer we will read from to create the Query
Throws:
ParserException

Method Detail

evaluate

public boolean evaluate(java.lang.StringBuffer strBuffer)
                 throws ParserException
Evaluates the query for all combinations of constants from the domain, for all variables in the query.

Precondition: PredicateList.evaluate().Precondition
Postcondition: PredicateList.evaluate().PostCondition AND
  strBuffer = strBuffer + toString()

Parameters:
strBuffer - the buffer in which we store the result.
Returns:
true iff we found a substitution for the variables in the Query
Throws:
ParserException

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns the lexical form of the query plus the results of the query.

Precondition: none
Postcondition: copy = null ⇒ reuslt = super.toString() + setOfSolutions.toString() + "\n" AND
  copy ≠ null ⇒ reuslt = copy.toString() + setOfSolutions.toString() + "\n"

Overrides:
toString in class List
Returns:
the lexical representation of the Query

setVariableToValue

public void setVariableToValue(Identifier variable,
                               Constant value)
                        throws ParserException
Everyplace in the predicate list where variable appears, it is replaced by the given value and we remember what that value was so we can print it later.

Precondition: variable ≠ null AND
  value ≠ null
Postcondition: Everyplace where variable appeared in the predicateList it has been replaced by the given value.

Overrides:
setVariableToValue in class PredicateList
Parameters:
variable - all variables with this name are changed to the given value.
value - the value we are going to change the variable(s) to.
Throws:
ParserException
See Also:
Source Code

initializeVariableInformation

protected void initializeVariableInformation()
Setup the PredicateList with all information as to a variable and its locations in the predicate list. So that we can later store the values substituted for variables we use a QueryVariableInformation rather then VariableInformation.

Precondition: none
Postcondition: varialbeInformation instanceof QueryVariableInformation AND
  setUpVariableLocationMapping.Postcondition

Overrides:
initializeVariableInformation in class PredicateList
See Also:
Source Code

keepOnGoing

protected boolean keepOnGoing(boolean validSolutionFound)
Should we continue finding all combinations of constants? If we are recursing over a predicate list, then we can stop the first time we find a true one, if this is a query, then we never stop. Since this is a query we never stop.

Precondition: None. Ignore validSolutionFound.
Postcondition: result = true

Overrides:
keepOnGoing in class PredicateList
Parameters:
validSolutionFound - indicates whether or not a valid solution was found. In this case we don't care but in PredicateList we do.
Returns:
true always -- for Querys we try all possible combinations.
See Also:
